review_blob: 750mm bottle- pours a cloudy reddish brown color with a tan head. Aroma of caramel and brown sugar. Flavor is chocolate and some caramel and is quite warm to the palate. Chewiness was noted as this is not a timid beer. Once again Alesmith has delivered. Well done.

Bomber bottle. Pours dark with a quickly disappearing head. Roasted malt flavor. Some caramel and coffee notes as well. Fairly smooth finish with a slight hop bite. Very good stout but have had better.
beer_name: Bear Republic Big Bear Black Stout

review_blob: 750ml bottle. Pours a dark heavy black with a light brown head. Aroma of coffee and some chocolate. Flavor of coffee and chocolate. Some alcohol noted as it is a 12% abv brew. Very rich tasting and smooth overall. May be the best stout I have tasted. Highly recommended if you have not had this one before. Good job Alesmith.

750 ml corked and caged.  Pours a dark orange red with a large, long lasting carbonated head. Aroma of brown sugar and caramel noted. Yeast taste noted with some spiciness as well. Alcohol was there but just a slight hint of it. Well balanced and smooth going down. Another great brew from the Grinning Monk.
750 bottle. Pours a deep black with  a thin head. Tastes thin and not rich or heady at all for a chocolate stout. Drinkable but nothing great compared to Speedway, Choklat, or Rogue Chocolate stout.
beer_name: Arcadia Cocoa Loco Triple Chocolate Stout

review_blob: 22oz bottle. Pours a rich golden amber color. White head that disappears fairly fast leaving behind sticky lacing.  Great bitter citrus taste with good note of hops. Not overpowering as far as DIPAs go but well balanced. Drinkable to say the least as alcohol is fairly well hidden. Another very good offering from Great Divide.

750ml bottle corked and caged from batch 18. Opens with a solid pop. Pours a cloudy golden amber color with a nice foamy white head. Flavor of malts and spices with a slight caramel undertone. Not overpowering in flavor but balanced nicely. A bit of carbonation noted as well. Nice and smooth going down. No alcohol presence noted. A very good offering from Allagash once again. Well done.

500ml bottle- pours a rich amber color with a nice tan  2 finger head. Slight malty aroma noted. Caramel and chocolate noted on the initial taste. Smooth with a hint of hops. Alcohol is there but never become intrusive. Easy to drink and a pretty well done Doppelbock overall.

750ml bottle-pours a light reddish-brown color with a nice thick head. Slight aroma once poured. Caramel and malts in the flavor. Slight yeast presence but not like a lot of other Belgians. Good taste overall with some carbonation noted. Smooth with a slight alcohol note on the finish. I enjoyed this one a lot. Will buy again

beer_brewer_name: Port Brewing Co / The Lost Abbey
review_blob: 4 month old 750ml bottle- pours a reddish-brown color. Slight head to this one. Fruity aroma. Was very fruity and sweet. A lot of flavor going on. Plums, raisins, and some prune notes.  A hint of alcohol in the finish. Overall a good brew well worth the wait.
22oz bottle- pours dark brown with a coffee aroma. Coffee, with some chocolate notes in the flavor.Medium bodied. Not terribly complex but still a good brew overall.

750 ml bottle- pours a nice light amber color with a white foamy head. Carbonation noted when in glass.  Flavor mostly composed of fruits. Light spicy flavor. Very smooth. 10% abv? Could have fooled me. Overall a very good offering from Allagash.
22 oz bottle- poured dark and rich. Tasted of roasted coffee and oak. Smooth going down and easy to drink. Wonderfully balanced and overall a very good offering from Great Divide.
beer_name: Great Divide Yeti Imperial Stout - Oak Aged

review_blob: 16.9 oz bottle- pours a cloudy orange color, nice foamy white head. Wheat taste to it as well as a hint of banana. Refreshing to drink but not too light. Clean and easy to drink overall. A pretty good Weissbier.

22oz bomber- once opened the room was full of a hoppy aroma. pours a nice golden color with a white head. Strong taste of hops and  pines on the palate. Very smooth going down. taste a bit of the alcohol but still very easy to drink. Laves a bitter aftertaste which I like. Overall a very good IIPA. Another well done brew from Southern Tier.

12oz bottle (thanks Thermo1223)- pours a nice amber color with a quickly disappearing head. Very clear looking brew. Tastes of honey and caramel noted with the alcohol well hidden at 7.9%. Fairly rich taste and heavy but enjoyable and easy to drink. My first Paulaner Doppelbock  and a very good one.
UPDATED: FEB 22, 2008
on tap at the Sunset in Boston Very hoppy aroma, easily drinkable. Head disappeared quicky, bitter but smooth. Very well done Lagunitas. Definitely my favorite from you guys.

22oz bomber-  pours a golden honey color. creamy white head. Aroma of hops and citrus noted. Tasted of grapefruit and bitter hops. Very clean and smooth tasting. Drinks as smooth as the flavor. Not overpowering like an IIPA but one that is good as a session. Overall a good IPA.

500ml bottle-pours a golden honey color with a lot of carbonation. Thin head dissipates fairly quickly. Hints of banana in the flavor. Strong wheat flavor noted. Fairly easy to drink and overall a good brew.

22oz bomber-pours a dark color with a creamy tan head. Tastes of bittersweet chocolate. Not sweet at all. Very smooth and creamy. Slight carbonation with a chocolate finish. Cannot taste any alcohol. One of my favorite chocolate stouts. Good job Rogue

12oz bottle- dark amber pour. Creamy white head. Aroma with a fruity presence noted. Fairly sweet on the palate and no bitterness detected. Overall much better than when I first tried it. An excellent brew from Unibroue.

16.9oz bottle- pours a reddish copper color. light off white head. Aroma of malts. Light, crisp and clean tasting. Very easy to drink and could have a few of these fairly easily.
A good Dunkleweizen overall.
UPDATED: DEC 31, 2007

12oz bottle-pours black. quickly disappearing mocha cream head. Roasted malt and a slight alcohol taste. Definitely some chocolate as well. Not a big beer but I could have more than one of these and still have my wits about me. Very good, I like this one more than the Sam Smith Oatmeal stout.

12 oz bottle- pours a hazy reddish brown color. Thin head that disappears slowly. Taste of hops and a slight oak flavor. Very smooth mouthfeel. Not an offending beer at all and at 7.2% it is very drinkable. Another good offering from Stone. Well done.

22oz bottle- pours a very dark black. Strong aroma of chocolate and coffee. Thin head disappears quickly. Thick and sweet taste to this one. Rich tasting brew and it lets you know it. Alcohol is very well hidden for a 12% brew but there is a slight warming to the palate.
Definitely a beer to spend some time with. Not for the weak of heart. Another great Southern Tier offering.
beer_name: Southern Tier Jah-va Imperial Coffee Stout

review_blob:
12oz bottle- pours a reddish brown color with a quickly disappearing head. Malty aroma noted. Very smooth and light on the palate. Extremely easy to drink. Not very strong in terms of alcohol but what is there is well hidden.
Overall a very good Doppelbock.

bomber-pours a nice golden color with a thick off white head. Some sweetness followed by a disappearing bitterness. Smooth and easy to drink. Alcohol is well hidden for a 9% IIPA. I like the balance in this one. Nothing is overpowering to me. Definitely one to buy again. Great beer.

beer_brewer_name: Schneider Weisse G. Schneider & Sohn GmbH
review_blob: 12oz bottle- pours a cloudy brown with good carbonation. Head dissipates quickly. Aroma is strong with this one. Almost smells like a Unibroue. Taste raisins and the alcohol is well hidden for a 12% brew. Very easy to drink. Overall an extremely well done German brew.

12oz bottle- pours black with a thick cocoa head. Roasted coffee noted in the aroma. Really rich flavor with chocolate and malt. Smooth and highly drinkable with the alcohol well masked for a 9.1% abv. Definitely a top 5 stout of mine and one of my favorite brews. Always looking forward to this one.

12oz bottle- pours a hazy reddish brown color with a creamy tan head. Lacing lingers on the glass. Some alcohol noted in the taste along with caramel and malts. Pretty easy to drink and could have another. My first Scotch ale and it will not be my last. Very well done Founders.

07-08 bottle: pours pitch black with a slight creamy brown head. Coffee and chocolate in the aroma and to the palate. Very smooth and drinkable. Alcohol is well hidden for a 10.6% abv brew. Overall it is one of my favorite stouts and one I look forward to each year. I need to get more of this stuff and cellar it.

12oz bottle- pours a cloudy ruby color with a fairly thick head. Fruit notes on the aroma and a definite yeast presence on the palate. Taste raisins in the flavor. Still smooth and cannot taste the alcohol at all. Easy to drink and pretty good overall. Another good Unibroue for me.

bomber- pours a nice honey color with thick creamy white head. Left lacing around the glass rim. Nice floral aroma with a slightly bitter flavor. No alcohol burn noted as this one is kind of tame for me. Smooth on the palate and easy to drink. Overall a good beer from SN.
beer_name: Sierra Nevada Harvest Wet Hop IPA - Northern Hemisphere

review_blob: 12oz bottle- pours a nice reddish color. Sweet malt noted on both aroma and palate. Smooth and very drinkable. No bitterness noted. A good beer just not spectacular or complex.

22oz bottle. Poured a dark amber color. Fairly thick head with strong spicy aroma. Nutmeg and cinnamon noted in the flavor. Alcohol fairly hidden. Smooth and easy to drink for such a  spicy beer. Felt like I was drinking Thanksgiving and Halloween in a bottle. Very good pumpkin ale overall

12 oz bottle- pours a golden amber color with a quickly disappearing head. Lacing sticks to the glass for some time. Strong aroma of hops and floral elements. Bitter on the palate but chewy. A bit of alcohol burn on the finish. Overall a great IIPA. One of my top 5 for the category.

12oz bottle-pours black, thin head, rich chocolate aroma noted. Good flavor but kind of thin for an imperial stout. No alcohol burn in this one. Smooth mouth feel with little bitterness.   A good stout overall but not "chewy" like others.

12 oz bottle (2007) Pours an amber color with a white head. Freash aroma that is not overpowering. Some bitterness to the palate but still clean. Good hoppiness to the flavor. Not too powerful at 6.8%, definitely can drink more than one. One of the better Sierra Nevada offerings.
